pages.text: Soundfonts are files that store the actual sound data used by a software synthesizer to produce sound from MIDI data.$(br2)Java contains a default Soundfont that it uses when playing MIDI data if no other Soundfont is provided, and by default this is what you will hear in this mod.

pages.title: Purpose
pages.text: While the default Soundfont contains sounds for all 128 GM MIDI programs these sounds are not very high quality and are intended to serve more as a convenience than a high-quality sound for music production.$(br2)Using a Soundfont allows music producers to use their own sound data for a MIDI synthesizer and produce much higher quality and unique songs.

pages.title: Types of Soundfonts
pages.text: Soundfonts are used in a variety of ways. Some may only contain sound data for a single MIDI program (such as a specific guitar or sound effect), while others may contain data for many different MIDI programs.$(br2)Soundfonts that contain sound data for all 128 GM MIDI programs are referred to as GM Soundfonts.

pages.title: Finding Soundfonts
pages.text: Many Soundfonts are available to find online, though often they are not free to use. Creating a high-quality Soundfont requires a lot of work and thus finding free Soundfonts can sometimes be a challenge.$(br2)A good source of free Soundfonts (with varying licenses) is available $(l:https://musical-artifacts.com/artifacts?formats=sf2)here$(/l).
